page.title: 07THE BUDDHIST MONASTERY
page.content: A group of{Buddhists}moved from Sussex to Great Gaddesden in August 1984 to practise their RELIGION. Their monastery is surrounded by 31 acres of land and a pagoda holding their holy relics is kept there. At present about 35 people live there, mostly men but no children.People can join a community of monks called a Sangha at any age, the BUDDHISTS in this monastery are aged from 16 to 90.Their LIFESTYLE attracts many visitors to the monastery.After two years training the Buddhists' possessions are distributed equally.Many rules are obeyed;Buddhists must not harm living creatures or carry weapons.Alcohol & some meats are forbidden.They practise YOGA & walk great distances.They meet & confess their sins every fortnight.The Abbot has lived in the monastery the longest.
